content.text:
# Subpoena

> In the name of the State of Oregon you are commanded to appear as a witness on behalf ot the State of Oregon in Multnomah County circuit Court, Room ███.

I'm rarely "commanded" to do anything, but it's been a while since I commanded to do something "in the name" or "on the behalf" of the state. Anyway, last year I woke up around 04:00 to screaming and saw a guy locking my neighbor on her snowy third-floor balcony. She asked me to call 911, one neighbor dropped a blanket to her from the roof, and others started driving around the neighborhood looking for the guy.

Cops showed up and waited for the apartment manager, saying things they learned from [Cops][0] like "show's over, folks, go back inside", and eventually my neighbor was able to get back in through a window. Last week I get a subpoena to act as a witness at a domestic violence trial, scheduled for Tuesday.

Have any of you been subpoenaed or have experience being called as a witness? It's totally possible that they won't even ask me anything, but I haven't done it before and I'm wondering how it will go. I'm not happy with the way we cage humans (or other animals), so contributing to the prison industrial complex feels *not great*, but domestic violence isn't a hill I'm ever planning to die on. 

[0]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cops_(TV_series)#Negative
